comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: LOC: The caption has the previous caption appended to this photo's caption. It should read "German soldiers in the Aishe District" only.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The caption is a misreading of the negative, which says "Aisne District", referring to the Aisne River, northeast of Paris, which was the scene of heavy fighting in the first months of the war.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks artolog, this clearly should be Aisne. I was also interested in what the sign says. I think you are correct that it says Wolfs Schlucht, which I found very interesting because it's the name Hitler used for his two military headquarters in WWII. I looked a little further and the name comes up fairly often, even before WWI. German Wikipedia has a list of places named Wolfsschlucht at de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolfsschlucht.
